page.title: 17HOMES IN GORING & STREATLEY
page.content:
In the whole area the oldest house we saw is{Stuart}and it is thatched with timber beams in the wall and small windows and has been pebble-dashed.
We noticed that most of the houses in the High Street, Streatley are{Georgian}with some modern houses built in neo-Georgian style nearby.
The Georgian houses are large and square, usually with three storeys attractive corner stones and sometimes pillars at the main entrance.
We also identified{Victorian} houses by their fancy brick work, long sash windows,tall chimneys and large gardens.Streatley also has traditional {brick and flint}cottages.
